About.title: About Me
About.headline: With footsteps as gentle as a kitten’s and curiosity as vast as the cosmos, I approach software development with calm determination and a committed mindset.
About.description: I believe great code is crafted not only through logic but also with patience, empathy, and a deep understanding of what truly matters.

body.line1: Primarily focused on backend development using Java and Spring, I have specialised in API design, system architecture, and developing internal tools.
body.line2: I also have a strong interest in frontend development, having participated in UI projects using TypeScript and React.js, leading full-stack initiatives.
body.line3: Working within cross-functional teams, I have collaborated closely with developers, PMs, designers, and marketers—leading planning meetings, proposing improvements, and actively sharing service feedback. I also contributed to continuous post-launch monitoring to enhance service quality.
body.line4: For one year from March 2024, I lived in Dublin, Ireland for language studies, where I gained valuable experience communicating and collaborating with people from diverse cultural backgrounds, fostering an open mindset and strong communication skills.

line1.content: Co-translator of “How to Learn to Code and Get a Developer Job” (2023) – Volunteered with freeCodeCamp Korea alongside 12 team members

line2.content: Volunteer translator (2022) – Translated Python articles for freeCodeCamp to make learning accessible to Korean learners

line1.content: Speaker at GDG (Google Developers Group) Songdo DevFest (2023) – Presented on “Improving Server Log Management for Junior Developers”

line2.content: Speaker at Seoul Women IT’s (2023) – Shared my career transition story and community engagement experience

community.title: Community Involvement
community.line1: Board Member at Girls in Tech Korea (2023–2024) – Led tech seminars and training programmes, including mentoring and interactive sessions, in partnership with AWS Korea, EA Korea, and Trend Micro
community.line2: Evaluator at the SW Gifted Creation Competition (2023), hosted by the Ministry of Science and ICT – Assessed primary school division projects
community.line3: Candidate Assessor at DAY 1 COMPANY (2022–2023) – Reviewed bootcamp applications and interviews as an external assessor
community.line4: Bootcamp Mentor at Code States (2022) – Guided mentees with projects and career coaching
